title: Advanced Headshot Retouching Workflow with Evoto
summary: Photographer Peter Hurley demonstrates an efficient AI-powered retouching workflow using Evoto. The tutorial covers removing tattoos, eliminating glass glare, cleaning up background distractions, and syncing edits across multiple images to speed up post-production.

steps.action: Navigate to 'Body Refinement' and enable the 'Tattoos (Beta)' toggle to automatically remove tattoos from the subject's skin.
Adjust 'Body Skin' settings under 'Skin Retouching'. Avoid setting 'Frequency Separation' too high to maintain a natural look.
Go to 'Background Adjustments' and enable 'Distraction Removal' to automatically remove unwanted studio lights or objects from the background.
Select multiple images and click 'Sync' to apply the retouching settings from the current image to the rest of the selection.
Fine-tune the 'Remove Glass Glare' slider under 'Eyes' to reduce reflections on glasses without making the eyes look unnatural.
Review synced images individually. If the AI incorrectly identifies clothing patterns as tattoos, manually disable the 'Tattoos' setting for that specific image.

key_takeaways: AI tools can drastically reduce retouching time for complex tasks like tattoo and glare removal.
Syncing settings across a batch is efficient, but individual review is necessary to correct AI misinterpretations (e.g., confusing shirt patterns for tattoos).
Subtlety is key; adjusting sliders to less than 100% often yields more realistic results.
